author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special court attached a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus on Thursday as the corporation failed to disburse compensation to an accident victim’s family.

Murugesan (60) of Mel Puzhuthiyur village was killed by a TNSTC bus near his village in April 2012. After trial, the special court for motor vehicle accident cases pronounced a judgment in December 2013 in which it directed the TNSTC to pay Rs.4.34 lakh as compensation to the victim’s family. As the corporation has not paid the amount, court ordered the corporation to pay the compensation with interest. As the corporation failed to pay that amount even after that, victim’s family filed execution petition and the court ordered to attach a TNSTC bus on January 19 this year. To implement the order, court staffs attached a bus plying in Tiruvannamalai-Bangalore route.
title: Court attaches TNSTC bus
